statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Joshua Braun scored 26 points and Grandy Glaze had a double-double with 15 rebounds and 10 points as Grand Canyon beat Missouri-Kansas City 78-66 Thursday night.
article.headline: Grand Canyon dumps UMKC 78-66 behind 26 pts from Braun
article.linkText: Grand Canyon dumps UMKC 78-66 behind 26 pts from Braun
article.story: PHOENIX -- Joshua Braun scored 26 points and Grandy Glaze had a double-double with 15 rebounds and 10 points as Grand Canyon beat Missouri-Kansas City 78-66 Thursday night. Braun made all 12 of his free throw attempts. Grand Canyon (23-4, 9-2 Western Athletic Conference) ran its win streak to four games while UMKC (10-16, 3-8) fell to 1-12 this season on the road. Martez Harrison scored 18 points and Lavell Boyd added 13 for the Kangaroos. The Antelopes used an 11-2 first-half run, with five points coming from Braun's 3-pointer and two free throws, and led 37-25 at halftime. Braun started the second half with a four-point play, and Gerard Martin followed with a 3 to make it 44-28 with 18 minutes left in the game. Grand Canyon shot 10 for 20 from 3-point range and 22 for 26 from the free throw line.
